title: The Cost of Connection

panel_structure.description: Wide shot of memory swamp with cypress trees reflecting not images but feelings, water clarity shifting with emotional weight
Medium shot of Evan wading deeper, memories rippling outward, while Architect hovers at the edge, patterns reflecting in murky water
Close on their reflections merging in the water, showing unified form that exists nowhere but in the reflection
panel_structure.focus: Unity possible only in liminal spaces

key_themes: vulnerability of letting another into your past
connection through mutual recognition of pain
transformation_notes: The memory swamp becomes a metaphor for sharing traumatic or formative experiences. The water's clarity represents how much each is willing to reveal.
dialogue_rhythm: Hesitant, with long pauses and half-finished thoughts
narrator_role: Memory keeper and witness to brave sharing
